alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 24 at 1:00AM AKST until February 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Visibility one quarter mile or less. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Blowing snow will cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
